network+.question: Your current network uses MLPS for secure transactions. You want to move to Secure SDWAN in the interest of security. Which of these choices best justifies your case?
network+.answer: Secure SDWAN provides better security than MLPS

network+.question: An Angled Physical Contact (APC) on a fiber optic cable provides which of the following advantages over a UPC connection?
When the route for an IP message to reach a destination is not known, where is the message forwarded to?
Which transmission type is used in streaming and can be sent specifically to multiple network nodes simultaneously?
Which protocol is used to assign IP addresses automatically?
What is the function of a router in a network?
network+.answer: To route data packets between different networks

network+.question: What is the main purpose of using VLANs in a network?
network+.answer: To segment a network into separate, isolated sections

network+.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for data encryption?
What is the primary difference between a hub and a switch?
network+.answer: A switch sends data to the specific device, while a hub broadcasts it to all devices

network+.question: Which command-line utility is used to display the routing table on a Windows machine?
Which protocol is commonly used to manage network devices?
What does the term 'bandwidth' refer to in networking?
network+.answer: The maximum rate of data transfer across a given path

network+.question: What type of cable is used to connect two switches directly?
What is the purpose of a DMZ in network security?
network+.answer: To add an additional layer of security to an organization's local area network (LAN)

network+.question: What is the function of a firewall in a network?
network+.answer: To block unauthorized access while permitting outward communication

network+.question: Which command can be used to test the reachability of a host on an IP network?
What type of attack is mitigated by disabling unused ports on a network switch?
Which wireless security protocol is considered the most secure?
What does the term 'latency' refer to in networking?
network+.answer: The delay before a transfer of data begins following an instruction for its transfer

network+.question: What is the primary function of a proxy server?
network+.answer: To act as an intermediary for requests from clients seeking resources from other servers

network+.question:
Which of the following cable types is used to connect a computer to a switch?
A) Crossover cable
B) Rollover cable
C) Straight-through cable
D) Console cable

What is the primary function of a DHCP server?
A) To resolve domain names to IP addresses
B) To assign IP addresses to devices on a network
C) To filter network traffic based on predefined rules
D) To provide authentication and authorization services

Which network topology has a central device that connects all other devices?
A) Mesh
B) Star
C) Ring
D) Bus

Which port number is used by the HTTPS protocol?
A) 22
B) 80
C) 443
D) 25

What is the purpose of a subnet mask?
A) To determine the network address of an IP address
B) To identify the default gateway of a network
C) To specify the range of IP addresses that can be used on a network
D) To encrypt network traffic for security

Which of the following is a type of denial-of-service (DoS) attack?
A) Man-in-the-middle attack
B) SQL injection attack
C) Phishing attack
D) SYN flood attack

What does the acronym SSID stand for in wireless networking?
A) Secure Socket Identification
B) Service Set Identifier
C) System Security Identifier
D) Standard Service Interface

Which of the following is a common protocol used for network management?
A) SMTP
B) SNMP
C) FTP
D) HTTP

Which type of firewall inspects the contents of packets to determine whether to allow or deny them?
A) Packet filtering firewall
B) Stateful inspection firewall
C) Proxy firewall
D) Next-generation firewall (NGFW)

What is the function of a router in a network?
A) To connect devices on the same network segment
B) To forward traffic between different networks
C) To filter network traffic based on IP addresses
D) To translate domain names to IP addresses

Which of the following protocols is used to resolve domain names to IP addresses?
A) DHCP
B) DNS
C) ARP
D) ICMP

Which OSI layer is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating sessions between applications?
A) Application layer
B) Session layer
C) Transport layer
D) Network layer

Which type of network cable is the most susceptible to electromagnetic interference (EMI)?
A) Unshielded twisted pair (UTP)
B) Shielded twisted pair (STP)
C) Coaxial cable
D) Fiber optic cable

What is the purpose of a VLAN?
A) To separate physical networks
B) To logically segment a network
C) To improve network security
D) To increase network bandwidth

Which of the following is a private IP address?
A) 10.0.0.1
B) 172.31.1.1
C) 192.168.1.1
D) All of the above

What is the difference between a hub and a switch?
A) A hub broadcasts traffic to all connected devices, while a switch forwards traffic only to the intended recipient.
B) A hub operates at Layer 2 of the OSI model, while a switch operates at Layer 3.
C) A hub can support multiple VLANs, while a switch cannot.
D) A hub is used to connect devices on different networks, while a switch is used to connect devices on the same network.

Which of the following is a type of wireless network encryption protocol?
A) WPA2
B) WEP
C) TKIP
D) All of the above

What is the purpose of a DMZ (demilitarized zone) in a network?
A) To store sensitive data
B) To isolate public-facing servers from the internal network
C) To provide a secure connection between two networks
D) To prevent unauthorized access to a network

Which of the following is a common network troubleshooting tool?
A) Ping
B) Traceroute
C) nslookup
D) All of the above

Which type of cable is used to connect a computer to a router?
A) Crossover cable
B) Rollover cable
C) Straight-through cable
D) Console cable

What is the purpose of a VPN (virtual private network)?
A) To encrypt network traffic
B) To create a secure connection over a public network
C) To bypass firewalls
D) All of the above

Which of the following is a type of network address translation (NAT)?
A) Port Address Translation (PAT)
B) Static NAT
C) Dynamic NAT
D) All of the above

Which protocol is used to secure web traffic?
A) HTTP
B) FTP
C) SSH
D) HTTPS

What does the term "latency" refer to in networking?
A) The amount of data that can be transmitted over a network in a given time
B) The time it takes for a packet to travel from source to destination
C) The number of hops a packet takes to reach its destination
D) The reliability of a network connection

Which of the following is a type of fiber optic cable connector?
A) SC
B) ST
C) LC
D) All of the above

What is the difference between TCP and UDP?
A) TCP is a connection-oriented protocol, while UDP is a connectionless protocol.
B) TCP guarantees delivery of packets, while UDP does not.
C) TCP is used for reliable data transmission, while UDP is used for real-time applications.
D) All of the above

Which of the following is a network device that operates at Layer 2 of the OSI model?
A) Router
B) Switch
C) Hub
D) Firewall

What is the purpose of a default gateway?
A) To provide access to the internet
B) To route traffic between different networks
C) To filter network traffic based on IP addresses
D) To translate domain names to IP addresses

Which of the following is a type of network topology?
A) Star
B) Bus
C) Ring
D) All of the above
